<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 20"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Aura of Unbreakable Virtue](/Feats.aspx?ID=1161) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Age of Ashes</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Champion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=24" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #150: Broken Promises](/Sources.aspx?ID=15) pg. 76</row>

**Prerequisites**
[tenets of good](/Tenets.aspx?ID=1)

</column>

---

You are a paragon of all that is good, your overwhelming aura causing evildoers to cower. All evil creatures within 15 feet of you take a –1 status penalty to checks and DCs that target you or your allies. This penalty is –2 against creatures you have taken an oath against (such as dragons if you have the [Dragonslayer Oath](/Feats.aspx?ID=219) feat). You can choose to suppress or resume this aura as an action, which has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait.

<title level="2">Paragons of Promise</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #150: Broken Promises](/Sources.aspx?ID=15) pg. 75</row>

The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion—ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor’s Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise’s trainers and records unlock all of the following uncommon class feats.

**Related Feats**: [Apex Companion](/Feats.aspx?ID=1160), [Bloodline Metamorphosis](/Feats.aspx?ID=1162), [Efficient Alchemy (Paragon)](/Feats.aspx?ID=1163), [Emblazon Divinity](/Feats.aspx?ID=1164), [Enduring Debilitation](/Feats.aspx?ID=1165), [Golden Body](/Feats.aspx?ID=1166), [Song of the Fallen](/Feats.aspx?ID=1168), [Spell Mastery](/Feats.aspx?ID=1843), [Superior Sight](/Feats.aspx?ID=1170), [Ultimate Flexibility](/Feats.aspx?ID=1732), [Unstoppable Juggernaut](/Feats.aspx?ID=1631)
